page.title: 09How Laggan has kept in touch
page.content: Until 1980 Laggan had very poor T.V.reception. It was brought to our attention by our local Doctor that by 1981 401 line T.V. would be phased out and we would be without T.V. Our only solution (as advised by the B.B.C) was to have and maintain our own system. With help from the H.I.D.B who granted us aid,we set about the first of several self help schemes. The physical, geographical and electronic problems were solved and worked at by the people of Laggan under the guidance of their Doctor. The mast was erected on Dun da Lamb Pictish fort. All homes in Laggan can now receive colour T.V on 4 channels. Radio reception depends on equipment and geographical, but most people get all stations. Daily news papers are available by post at extra cost. Laggan is now fully"in touch".
